entries.title: Fall 2015 report card
entries.description: Precalculus: A, Home Economics: C, PE: A+

entries.title: Fed homeless at soup kitchen with Bernie

suggestions.idea: Many colleges consider sports to demonstrate the ability to work with a team, consider joining a team.
Coaching sports at camp is a great way to connect with younger kids, and helps build valuable leadership skills!
Some colleges require community service, but all colleges count look favorably on it during the admissions process.
Community service is excellent for your well-being! Consider volunteering for local community organizations.
Everyone is special. Check out clubs at your school and see if any interest you. If you find one, joining the club's leadership team looks great on your applications!
Colleges look for students that thrive both in and out of the classroom. Holding leadership roles is an ideal way to demonstrate that.
It's never too early to start planning for college!
Your history is very well rounded, keep up the good work!
